TopicTitle: Can we please having a surface mapping part already?

Articles.Content:
ISA mapsat is a relic and no one maintains it anymore.

PWEEEEEEAAAAAAASE can we just make this a part of the game. It's only 90% of the reasons NASA sends probes to orbit specific planets. We have the MRO and the one that's mapping the Moon (can't remember the name).

It would be nice to have two parts. one that gives elevation and then a high-science-cost part that maps biomes.

any support for this?

SCAN sat is great, but I don't think the UI is good enough for stock KSP. The mapping functions and displays need to be integrated in the Map View/tracking station.

The planet surface should be pixelated until mapped and there should to be various toggled display layers for different scanning systems. toggling the display layers combining the data should reveal biomes and anomalies so you can plan your missions.

each type should be unlocked as you progress through the tech tree.

standard visual camera - records visual light data. sharpens and improves on the pixcelated initial image captured via telescopes. *cannot see through clouds.

UV & infrared - can penetrate clouds and allow you to view the night side of the planet. (so you can reveal the surface of Eve)

thermal - see the temperature gradient and can reveal "hot spots" on the surface and in the atmosphere (a spot in the clouds of Jool).

elevation(radar) - gives a color coded height map of the surface aswell as a inclination so you can identify flat landing sites.

spectroscopic - another color coded map showing differences in mineral density and/or elements. identifies places for surface samples.

The mun is the perfect way to teach the player aswell. As it is tidally locked the far side has never been viewed. in the map view this could be blacked out with "no data available". when you get there and orbit the first time the missing image data would get filled in.

blah blah blah that's what would like to see.

Yes - there's a definite need here. To flesh the idea out, more:

1. Completing a map should reward you with science.

2. The map could help you identify the biomes to target landings in them.

3. The map could help you identify the elevations to target landings on flat spaces.

(@Doozler - I disagree; I'd like to see the mapper unlockable fairly comparable to the Mun/Minmus landers, so you have a meaningful choice to make.)

4. The map could, as ISA MapSat did, identify some "anomolous readings" to help direct the player's exploration(s).

(Alternately, anomalies could show up as very small unique biomes -- that would give us a science bonus for reaching them as well.)
